channel.title: BBC News - Latin America & Caribbean

item.title: Haiti struck by deadly 7.2-magnitude earthquake
item.description: At least 227 people are killed, and many more injured, by the powerful earthquake.

item.title: Nicaragua: Police raid offices of La Prensa newspaper
item.description: It comes a day after La Prensa said authorities were withholding its supplies of paper and ink.

item.title: Brazil Congress expels lawmaker over murder charges
item.description: Gospel singer turned lawmaker Flordelis de Souza is accused of ordering the murder of her husband.

item.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro defeated over printed ballot proposal
item.description: A plan by President Bolsonaro to switch to printed ballots fails to get enough support in Congress.

item.title: Tropical Storm Fred: Sixth Atlantic storm hints at above-average hurricane season
item.description: Meteorologists have named the sixth Atlantic storm of 2021, hinting at an above-average season.

item.title: Lionel Messi dreams of Champions League win at Paris St-Germain
item.description: Lionel Messi says he dreams of winning the Champions League once more after joining Paris St-Germain, adding: "I think we have the team to do it here."

item.title: Mexican drug cartel threatens to kill TV reporter
item.description: In a video featuring heavily armed men the prominent female journalist is accused of unfair coverage.

item.title: Climate change: At-risk nations fear extinction after IPCC report
item.description: The most vulnerable developing countries plead for action after a stark warning from a UN panel.

item.title: The labels encouraging Chileans to buy healthier food
item.description: Chile's government introduced food labelling five years ago to drive down its high obesity rate.

item.title: Fenty Beauty: How make-up helped Rihanna become a billionaire
item.description: Rihanna makes more money from her make-up than from her music and acting work.

item.title: Wildfires: How are they linked to climate change?
item.description: A series of major wildfires across the world has hit the headlines - how do they compare to previous years?

item.title: 'Lionel Messi feels betrayed by Barcelona' - the inside track on new PSG star's Nou Camp exit
item.description: Read the inside track on how Lionel Messi's Barcelona exit came about, with the club legend said to feel betrayed.

item.title: Children's home fire: 'The souls of our daughters are still there'
item.description: The mothers of teenage girls who died in a 2017 fire at a children's home in Guatemala want justice.

item.title: Lionel Messi: Barcelona star in tears as he receives ovation news conference
item.description: Lionel Messi is distraught as he receives a standing ovation from team-mates, journalists, officials and his family at a news conference confirming his departure from Barcelona.

item.title: 'Quicker, faster, better!' - Thompson-Herah's 'double-double'
item.description: Elaine Thompson-Herah confirms her place among the pantheon of sprint greats as she completes an Olympic 100m-200m double for the second time with a sensational victory in Tokyo.

item.title: Covid vaccines: Tourists head to the US to get vaccinated
item.description: Some tourists are spending thousands of dollars to travel to the US to get a coronavirus vaccine.

item.title: Petrol bombs thrown at Cuban embassy in Paris
item.description: Cuba's foreign ministry has released surveillance footage of the attack at its embassy in France.

item.title: Dust devil almost takes out football players at match in Bolivia
item.description: The whirlwind, often mistaken for a tornado, came as a shock but appeared to cause no damage in Bolivia.

item.title: Floridians rally in support of Cuban protesters
item.description: Across Florida, Cuban-Americans have been rallying to show their support for protests in Cuba.
